\u2018Congress-NCP will remain in opposi.description: NASHIK: Wishing the Nationalist Congress Party on its 20th anniversary on Monday, state minister for finance, planning and forest Sudhir Mungantiwar said the Congress and NCP will remain in opposition for the next 25 years. Addressing the media, Mungantiwar said people always support the party that operates in the interest of public. “The UPA led by Congress and NCP was in power at the Centre and state for 15 years. Now, it’s our turn. The BJP has been working in the interest of the people. Prime Minister Narendra Modi does whatever he says and hence people trusted him and gave the party an opportunity, Mungantiwar said. “I extend my wishes to the NCP on its anniversary and I wish that the party would continue to criticise BJP and it will remain in opposition for next 25 years,” he said. When asked about the next chief minister, Mungantiwar said, “BJP has its chief minister in the state and the next one too will be from BJP. Shiv Sena is our natural partner and both parties will have strong alliance in the coming assembly elections.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nashik engineer resists robbers at finan.description: NASHIK: It was the valour of 29-year-old IT engineer Muriyayikara Saju Samuel that saved lives and forced six armed men to beat a hasty retreat during a dacoity attempt at the Untawadi branch of Muthoot Finance here on Friday morning. Unfortunately, Samuel lost his own life when the robbers, angry with him for taking them on, pumped three bullets into him at point blank range. Samuel, who originally hails from Kerala, was currently residing in the Nerul area of Navi Mumbai with his wife and ten-month-old son. His widowed mother stays at his native place in Kerala. Nashik police commissioner Vishwas Nangare-Patil told TOI, "We have detained two persons in connection with the incident. We have CCTV footage in which the faces of the goons are clearly visible. Such a crime could not have happened without local support. We will crack the case soon." The robbers came on three motorcycles to the commercial complex which houses the finance company's office. Brandishing revolvers, they barged into the first floor office around 11.30am and forced seven employees and a few customers, including women, into a corner. When they saw Samuel and the auditor, Kailash Jayan (25), in a room in the back office, they dragged them out. However, before that, Samuel displayed presence of mind to press the burglar alarm. Samuel managed to free himself from the clutches of the robbers and rushed to help branch manager Chandrashekhar Deshpande (64), who was being repeatedly hit on the head with the butt of a revolver. The robbers were demanding that Deshpande hand over the keys of the strong room where cash and gold were kept. Deputy commissioner of police Amol Tambe told TOI, "Samuel took on the goons who were thrashing Deshpande and started pushing them back. However, one of them fired three rounds at him in the chest and he collapsed on the floor. As Samuel lay in a pool of blood, the robbers panicked and fled the office immediately without taking any cash or gold." Techie resists armed robbers at finance co’s office, shot deadSamuel was immediately rushed to the Nashik Civil Hospital where he was pronounced dead by the doctors. His relatives arrived from Nerul and took his body after the post mortem. According to the police, Samuel was in Nashik for the last couple of days, working to strengthen the IT system at the office. Nangare-Patil described Samuel as a strong person. "Eyewitnesses told us he alone retaliated when the robbers were thrashing Deshpande. It's sad that he lost his life in such a tragic manner," he said. Police officials, quoting some eyewitnesses, said the robbers spoke in Marathi. "We suspect they must have done a recce of the entire area before making this attempt to rob cash and gold from the office," they said. After the incident, the entire area around the commercial complex was cordoned off and sniffer dogs were pressed into service. There was traffic chaos in the area as vehicular movement on the busy road was stopped for over an hour. In a statement, R M Diwan, senior general manager of Muthoot Finance Ltd, said the operations at the branch would be temporarily suspended. "We are extending full co-operation to the investigating agencies and the police in the case. We will go the extra mile to extend necessary support to all the affected persons, including our staff, while protecting the customers' valuables. We are putting best efforts to ensure that such incidents do not arise in the future," he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Maharashtra to make forest laws more str.description: NASHIK: Forest minister Sudhir Mungantiwar on Monday said that the forest acts would be made more stringent through amendments for its effective implementation. “There are many acts related to forest and green environment, but these are not adhered to by the departments concerned. There is compulsion to develop green belts in industrial estates of MIDC and in other projects by various departments, but it is not implemented effectively,” said Mungantiwar, adding that laws would be made more effective with provision for penalty for its better implementation. The minister was here in the city on Monday for the review meeting related to tree plantation drive in Nashik division. The state government has set a target of planting 33crore trees in 90 days from July 1 to September 30. Nashik division, which includes five districts, has been given the target of planting 5.04crore trees this year. Out of this, 1.92crore has been earmarked for Nashik district, 1.17crore for Ahmednagar, 1.15crore for Jalgaon district, 65 lakh for Dhule, and 91 lakh for Nandurbar districts. There are a total of 395 nurseries in Nashik division, and 6.95crore saplings are to be made available through these nurseries. Around 5.04crore plants are ready for plantation in the division, he said. “Currently, green cover in the state is 6.92%, which will be increased to 33% in the next few years. Hence, we are involving public in tree plantation drive,” said Mungantiwar. Around 24.15crore trees were planted in the past three years since 2016, and the survival rate is over 66%. We are also planning to develop green cover on small spaces in the state through the involvement of people. We will soon introduce new scheme in this connection shortly, he added. “There has been a piece of land owned by the state dairy development department, which has been transferred to the forest department. We are planning to transfer this land to the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) to develop a zoo there," said Mungantiwar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Cash, articles worth Rs 3 lakh stolen fr.description: Nashik: Cash and articles worth Rs three lakh were stolen from five cars stationed by the road side in different parts of the city over Sunday and Monday.The incidents took place in regions of Gangapur, Indiranagar, Sakarwada and Mumbai naka police stations where unknown persons took away the loot.The biggest robbery was registered at Pandit colony when cash of Rs 1.95 lakh was stolen from a car that came under the jurisdiction of the Sarkarwada police station. The police said that the complainant had parked his car in front of an apartment at around 12.30 pm on Monday, when some unidentified person smashed the rear window of the car and stole the cash kept inside it.At around 10 pm on Sunday in Indiranagar, few unidentified persons smashed the rear window of a car parked near a hotel and stole cash of Rs 11,000 kept inside it. The burglars also stole other important documents like a bank cheque, pass books of two different banks, etc.On the same night at around 9 pm, unidentified miscreants broke the rear glass of car parked near a hotel in Bhonsala Circle, College Road and stole away cash and articles worth Rs 45,000. The stolen articles included a cellphone; shoes, bank pass-book, etc said the Gangapur police.In another case registered with the Mumbai Naka police, cash of Rs 15,000 and a tablet worth Rs 10,000 was stolen from a car parked near Tupsakhre Lawns at around 3 pm on Monday. In this case, the criminals had broken the front window glass of the car to steal the cash and cellphone tablet.In the fifth incident, a laptop and other articles worth Rs 20,000 were stolen from a car parked in front of the City Centre Mall on Monday at around 4.20 pm. Even in this case, the miscreant had broken the front window of the car.Senior police officials said that car owners should ensure that they park their vehicles in safer places and not leave heavy cash or other valuable articles inside the vehicle.A few months ago, there were a series of such burglaries from cars which later stopped occurring. A senior police officer said that for such thefts, criminals targeted vehicles which are at relatively secluded places and there is no one around to watch the theft they are committing. The criminals made sure that the glass shattered by them does not make any noise.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Narendra Modi.description: NEW DELHI: PM Narendra Modi used the first all-party meeting called after the elections to push for his "One Nation, One Election" idea at a meeting of leaders of political parties to be held on June 19. Making the announcement at the usual meeting of political parties called on the eve of the 17th Lok Sabha convening on Monday, Modi said Parliament should begin with "fresh zeal and new thinking". Wednesday's meeting is to also discuss how Parliament can be made more productive. Modi's invite extends to presidents of all the parties with presence in Parliament. Besides "One Nation, One Election", the meeting would discuss celebration of 75 years of India's Independence in 2022 and 150 years of Mahatma Gandhi's birth anniversary this year, parliamentary affairs minister Pralhad Joshi said. 1,610 electricity poles damaged in Nashi.description: NASHIK: As many as 1,610 electricity poles have been damaged in the four days of strong winds blowing across the district further leading to rains. “In all 769 electricity poles of Low Tension and 225 poles of High Tension power supply were damaged partially or fully during the strong winds that blew across the district bringing down the over-head electricity power lines causing power disruption almost everywhere,” Vijaysinh Doodhbhate, public relations officer of MSEDL, Nashik Zone, said. The incidents reported are from Nashik Circle alone where 994 poles were damaged. The Malegaon Circle of Nashik district also suffered heavily from the gusty winds that brought down 472 LT electricity poles and 144 HT poles. Across Nashik district – comprising both Nashik and Malegaon, 1241 LT poles and 369 HT poles summing up to 1,610 were damaged. “The extensive damaged caused by winds was in Nashik city where the density of consumers is very high. The largest numbers of consumers suffering due to lack of power was also from the urban areas,” the officer said. This forced the MSEDCL to bring all its might on the street to get faster recovery of the system. “The MSEDCL suffered dual blow – in the sense that the MSEDCK earns from the power distributed. Since the power supply was down, the MSEDCL lost its revenue for the power not consumed. On the other hand the infrastructure damage has also caused a huge blow to the MSEDCL – both of which will be calculated soon,” the officer Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Panchavati Express to arrive on PF 1.description: NASHIK: Finally, the long wait for Nashikites demanding that the Panchavati Express should arrive at PF 1 while coming from Mumbai, is now over as the Bhusawal Division of the Central Railways has cleared the proposal for the same. On Saturday, the DRM office cleared the proposal for bringing the Manmad (Nashik) — Mumbai intercity express on Home PF (PF 1) when it arrives from Mumbai in the evening, instead of PF 2 — on which it used to arrive till Friday. Vivek Gupta, who recently took over charge as DRM, Bhusawal, during his maiden visit to Nashik Road railway station on June 3, had asked the officials to take all the trials and measures to ensure that the train arrived on PF 1. Accordingly, after carrying out some measures, the proposal was finally cleared on Saturday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two arrested for murder of 19-year-old a.description: NASHIK: The Upnagar police have arrested two people on the charge of allegedly killing a 19-year-old youth in the Rahul Nagar area of Takli. The deceased has been identified as Sushil Pravin Gaikwad, a resident of Mathura Road, Vihitgaon. The police said the two suspects arrested in the murder case are Hamid Rashid Shaikh (21) and Sonu Swami (20), both residents of the Samata Nagar area. They were produced before a city court on Friday, which remanded them in police custody till June 10. The police said that Gaikwad operated the autorickshaw of Hamid Rashid Shaikh (21) on a rental basis. He also worked with a food catering firm and took Hamid's auto only when the firm did not have any order. On May 30, Gaikwad was operating the auto as usual on the stretch between Bytco, Deolali Camp and Bhagur, when he was caught by traffic constables during their routine drive against erring motorists. Since Gaikwad was not carrying the auto's documents and did not have enough money to pay the fine, the auto was seized by the cops. Gaikwad was told by the police to pay the fine in the court and then take back the auto. The Upnagar police said that Gaikwad had also informed the same to Hamid. He was also adamant that he would not pay the fine amount as he was not responsible for the incomplete documents. Meanwhile, Hamid got the autorickshaw back from the police by paying the fine. On June 5, when Sushil was taking a walk near his residence, Hamid Shaikh and Sonu Swami met him and asked him to forget the past incident. They later made him sit in the auto and took him to an open plot in Rahul Nagar. The three, however, started quarrelling about the police action and the fine. The verbal spat soon turned physical and the duo pushed him into a nearby well. People who were watching the brawl from a distance immediately rushed to the well when they saw Gaikwad falling into it, said senior PI of Upnagar police station, Bharat Kumar Suryawanshi. While the duo escaped from the scene, the residents of Rahul Nagar informed the fire brigade, after which a rescue team rushed the to the spot and fished Gaikwad out. He had died of drowning by the time he was taken out of the well. The case is being investigated further, said Suryawanshi. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

7 officials get show-cause notices over.description: NASHIK: The Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) on Tuesday served show-cause notices to seven officials from the garden department for negligence of duty. Over the past three days, several complaints of uprooted trees and fallen branches due to rain and gusty winds had reached the civic headquarters. Municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game has issued the show-cause notices, seeking immediate reply. It is alleged that the seven officials delayed their response to tackle the situation and dispose of the branches and uprooted trees from the roads. After pre-monsoon showers with gusty winds lashed the city from Saturday to Monday, over 100 trees along the roads were affected. It threw traffic out of gear in the city. At this juncture, quick response was expected from the officials of all six divisions of the municipal corporation. According to NMC sources, fire brigade department’s job is to remove trees causing hurdle to the traffic as part of rescue operations, but it is the responsibility of the garden department to dispose of the uprooted trees and fallen branches. The fire brigade sources said they had received over 100 calls of trees uprooted and felling of branches. Of these, 50 calls were related to uprooted trees, while the remaining 50 were related to fallen branches. Meanwhile, the NMC has set up disaster management cell across all six divisional offices. Its major cell is already operation at the head office of NMC –Rajiv Gandhi Bhavan. NMC has appealed to people to immediately contact the disaster manangment cells in their respective divisions in case of untoward incidents or tree falling, water accumulation or other such cases during the monsoon season. Delay in smart city projects likely to a.description: NASHIK: The management of the Nashik Municipal Smart City Development Corporation (NMSCDCL ) has proposed to the board of directors to impose Rs 37,000 per day penalty on the contractor for failing to complete the project on time. The chairman of the board Sitaram Kunthe while speaking to the media admitted that the contractor was slack in implementing the project. He said that the board would look into the proposal given by the management. The proposal had also mention of extending the deadline further from June 30 to July 25. “This is the fact that the smart road work is not gathering momentum. This is the road with heavy traffic as it has major government offices and institutes along the road. The notice has already been given to the concerned contractor for delay of the project,” said Kunte. As per the proposal by the management, the deadline was March 31, but it had been extended up to June 30 and thereafter July 25. Hence, the fine of Rs 37,000 per day has been proposal for a period from March 28 to July 25. As per the officials, the deadline has been increased thrice. The smart city road first had a deadline of October last year which was extended up to March 31 this year and finally it was set at June 30. But the works is likely not to be completed before June 30. Hence, NMSCDCL has proposed extension to the deadline upto July 25 and also Rs 37,000 per day fine from March 25 onwards. The pilot Smart Road stretch is from Trimbak Naka to Ashok Stambh, measuring about 1.1 km and the total cost of the project is Rs 16.15 crore. The NMSCDCL has also proposed rise of Rs 3.89 crore in the project cost due to some changes in the project and also because of the delay. This project is about transforming chaotic road image to a smart road. Proposed features of the smart road includes uniform standard carriage way from one junction to another, proper designed footpaths, bicycle lane, road intersection development, infrastructure utility ducts below footpaths, road marking, proper storm water drainage and landscaping to increase overall aesthetics of the road. Initially, due to heavy traffic they could not bring trucks of cement during the day, and hence, they brought it during the night after the traffic reduced. There were other reasons like underground channels, old sewage lines, old water supply lines had to be taken care of while constructing the road. Many such issues like these delayed the work. \nBhushan Pradhan and Mrinmai Kolwalkar.description: The cast of the upcoming movie 'Mismatch' was in town recently. The movie is about a girl who doesn’t believe in the concept of arranged marriage and how she is told to find a suitable match for herself by her parents. It has Bhushan Pradhan and Mrinmai Kolwalkar in lead roles. The cast along with producer Alok Shrivastava visited the Sai Baba temple and Salim’s Chai where many youngsters were eager to click photos with them.  This is Mrunmai’s debut film and she is pretty excited about it, “I always wanted to be an actor. After modeling for a while, I got this script which was very good and so I had no reason to reject it,” she said. Bhushan on his part has taken a liking to working out. It’s a good addiction and I suggest everyone should work out to stay fit.” Apart from sipping some cutting chai at Salim mamu’s stall, the actors were busy taking selfies with those present. — Prajkat Mudholkar Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nNashik college students to welcome New.description: From the evergreen Traditional day to the funky Mix-n-Match day, city college students are looking forward to welcome the New Year in their own trendy and fashionable way.  Unlike Pune and Mumbai colleges where annual festivals are usually a grand affair, Nashik college students prefer concentrating on the special days they celebrate. SMRK AK BK Mahila Mahavidyalay recently celebrated their days in college with much fanfare. Impressed with the way the students took care of everything, Dr Dipti Deshpande, principal of the college, expresses, “This time the girls managed everything and the staff only supervised.” The students definitely brought colour and fun on campus. Like SMRK, other colleges too look forward to celebrating these days. Kartik Pawar, a student of MVP College of Engineering says, “We eagerly wait to celebrate these days in college. They may not be as big as compared to the ones held in Mumbai or Pune colleges but we make sure everyone enjoys it to the fullest.” Almost all the colleges in city have a common pattern of days like Sari Day, Tie Day, Mix-n-Match Day, Traditional Day among others. Few colleges even celebrate Rose Day and Chocolate Day. Competitions like singing, dancing, and poetry reading are also included at the events. Sometimes they get participation from Pune and Mumbai colleges as well. Though the idea is to have fun, the college authorities also help the students brush up their entrepreneurial skills. “Students manage to get the sponsors for certain events and competitions. In a way, it kind of prepares future entrepreneurs,” shares Dr Dhanesh Kalal, principal of BYK College. In all this, these colleges also maintain the fact that academic shouldn't be affected. And hence, balance these extracurricular activities with the academics. Dr Dilip Dhondge, principal of KTHM College informs, “We celebrate all the days in our college and conduct the competitions faculty wise. We try our best that students don't miss out on academics.” So which day will you pick to show off your stylish and quirky side? Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nashik division fourth in Maharashtra wi.description: NASHIK: Up two ranks from last year’s sixth position, the Nashik division came fourth at the state-level secondary school certificate (SSC) examination after it scored a pass percentage of 77.58% in the results that were declared on Saturday. On the flip side, though, the pass percentage of the division has dropped by a whopping 10%, from last year’s 87.42%. Nashik district topped the charts at the division level with 78.86%; Dhule district stood second in the division with 77.11%, followed by Jalgaon district with 76.92%; and Nandurbar at 74.44% Nitin Upasani, divisional secretary, Maharasthra State Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board, Nashik division, attributed the drop in pass percentage to the change in the examination pattern. He called for improved training of students in the activity-based question paper. “While teachers have already received training in the activity-based questions, we would once again train students for the changed question paper patterns. Students will be trained at school level, taluka level and district level in the current academic year,” Upasani said. He said the drop in pass percentage was witnessed across the state and not just the division. The overall pass percentage of the state has dropped by 12% Apart from this, the 30-mark internal exam for language and social science, which was discontinued from this year, also impacted the overall pass percentage across the division and the state. Overall, 1,98,750 students from the division had appeared for the SSC exam, including 71,487 students from the district. From that number, 1,54,193 students passed the exam in the division, including 71,487 from Nashik district. Girls continued to perform better than boys with 82.81% girls passing the exam as against 73.31% boys. Senior educationists from the city described this as a regular feature of the SSC and HSC results. In Nashik district, a total of 90,656 students had appeared for the exams from 196 examination centres. Among the 71,487 students who passed the exam, 16,874 (18.61 %) passed with distinction; 29,816 (32.88 %) with first class; 21,305 (23.5%) with second class; and 3492 (3.85 %) with pass class. There was also a notable increase in cheating cases in the division. There were 87 cases of cheating or copying in the March 2018 SSC exam. But this year, there were 225 such copying or cheating cases detected in the division. Most of the cheating or copying cases were from Jalgaon district (148 students); followed by 43 students in Nashik district; 19 cases in Dhule district; and 15 such incidents in Nandurbar district. Officials added that four students were debarred for three years, while the remaining were debarred from the exam for a year. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Maharashtra: 40 cyclists finish 120-km r.description: NASHIK: Nashik cyclists' ‘Ye Re Ye Re Pavasa’ ride was held on Sunday with 40 cyclists finishing the ride. The ride was planned to welcome the rains. But as it rained a night before, riders couldn't enjoy the showers. On the contrary, they had to face extreme heat. Yet the cyclists successfully participated in the ride. There were two formats of 40-km- and 120-km ride. The ride started at 6am from Shivshakti Cycles, Gangapur Road. Forty km riders were to go up to Ozar and return to Pimprikar's Hospital by 8.15am whereas 120-km riders were to further pedal up to Sogras Phata near Chandvad and return by 12.40pm. While returning the riders had to face a great challenge of hot sun, humidity and head wind too. But they braved it all and rode on. On the other side, young kids too enjoyed 20-km fun and joy ride up to Gammat Jammat and back. They were throughout their journey supplied with sufficient hydration like water, lime water, energy drinks, bananas, oranges, chikki etc. Bhausaheb Kale of Shivshakti Cycles flagged off the riders. NRM team comprising of Paramjeet and Davinder Singh Bhela, Chandrakant Naik, Mohan Desai and Suresh Dongre ensured meticulous planning and execution. They were duly assisted by Satish Mahajan, Shishir Acharya, Vaishali Marathe, Yash Desai, Dattatraya Borude and Dinesh Ingole. Next NRM 3.7 ride has been planned on July 14 as a tribute ride in the loving memory of Jaspal Singh Virdi, former president of Nashik Cyclists. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Parliament Session.description: NEW DELHI: The first session of the 17th Lok Sabha will commence from Monday during which the passage of the Union Budget and other key legislations such as triple talaq will be on top of the agenda for the government. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, chairing an all-party meeting on the eve of the first session of the new Lok Sabha, invited heads of all parties to a meeting on June 19 to discuss the "one nation, one election" issue and other important matters. Noting that there are many new faces in this Lok Sabha, PM Modi said the first session of the lower house of Parliament should begin with "fresh zeal and new thinking". At the all-party meeting, the Congress raised with the government issues of unemployment, farmers distress, drought, and press freedom, while also calling for early conduct of assembly polls in Jammu and Kashmir. The opposition parties demanded discussion on all such issues in Parliament, with the Congress asserting that it is still a "fight of ideologies". Prime Minister Modi, defence minister Rajnath Singh, leader of opposition in the Rajya Sabha Ghulam Nabi Azad, Congress lawmakers Adhir Ranjan Choudhary, K Suresh, National Conference leader Farooq Abdullah and TMC leader Derek O'Brien were present at the meeting. The BJP also held its parliamentary party meet on Sunday with Prime Minister Modi assuring Indians that his government will be at the forefront of facilitating legislation that manifests the spirit of "sabka saath, sabka vikas, sabka vishwas". A day before the first session of the newly-constituted 17th Lok Sabha, a meeting of the NDA was also held here. The government had promulgated as many as 10 ordinances for the session which ends on July 26 and will have 30 sittings. The first two days of the session will be used for administering oath of office to all Lok Sabha MPs. The oath will be administered by protem Speaker Virender Kumar. The Speaker will be elected on June 19 and the next day the President will address a joint sitting of both Houses. The budget will be introduced on July 5. Among the bills that will be introduced, the one on triple talaq could be a contentious one between the government and the opposition. Addressing the media after the all-party meeting, parliamentary affairs minister Prahlad Joshi said the Prime Minister urged leaders of all parties to "introspect whether members of Parliament are able to fulfil people's aspirations as their representatives and the manner in which last two years of the 16th Lok Sabha were wasted". An all-party meeting is a customary procedure before the beginning of every session of Parliament to ensure its smooth functioning. Joshi said the government has requested all parties, especially the opposition, for their cooperation for the smooth functioning of both Houses of Parliament. In order to build esprit de corps, PM Modi has invited presidents of all those parties who have an MP either in Lok Sabha or Rajya Sabha for a meeting on June 19. The meeting has been called to discuss "one nation, one election" issue, celebrations of 75 years of India's Independence in 2022 and 150 years of Mahatma Gandhi's birth anniversary this year, he said. It will be followed by a dinner meeting with all MPs of both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha on June 20 to freely interact and exchange views with the government, Joshi said, adding that these two novel initiatives would go a long way in building team spirit among all parliamentarians. In Video:First session of 17th Lok Sabha starts on June 17Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nAsha Murjani, Mamta Panjawani party to.description: Asha Murjani and Mamta Panjawani organised an all women party on the occasion of International Women’s Day last week. Competitions like best personality, most glamourously dressed, best western dress, best traditional dress and others were conducted at the do. The guests enjoyed themselves in various games including Housie. While some enjoyed the round of games played, some preferred dancing to some up-tempo music. The event also had a lavani performance presented by artiste Yugandhara. We spotted animal rights activist Sharanya Shetty, designer Ashi Luthra, Sunaina and Aanchal Madan, Vijaya Katakwar, Gunjan Ahuja at the event. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Police keep security guards on their toe.description: NASHIK: Over the past few weeks, the city police on night rounds are not only patrolling the area under their jurisdiction but also waking up sleeping security guards and watchmen in residential areas and at ATMs, banks and other financial institutions to prevent house break-ins and theft. Going by police records, the maximum number of house break-ins occur at night. This year, from January 1 to April 30, police registered 63 house break-ins during the night hours against six during the day time. The situation was same last year during the same period, with 67 house break-ins at night against 17 in the day time. Careless security personnel is one of the reasons for house break-ins and theftduring night. Senior officials said every day during night hours, a call is given to the police personnel on night duty to check security guards and watchmen from 2am to 5am. This is the time when most of the guards are found napping. DCP Amol Tambe said, “Alert security guards would definitely help in bringing down burglaries in the night. There are a large number of watchmen and security guards in various lanes and bylanes of the city. However most of them are found sleeping.” “We not only woke the security guards up but also click photos of them and sent it to their employers. On one occasion, we found all the three security guards at a jewellery store in Nashik Road fast asleep. After the photos of the napping security guards were sent to their employer, he installed a thumb impression machine and asked the guards to put their thumb impression every 10 minutes during their duty,” said Tambe. Tambe said some security agencies ensure that their personnel do their duty sincerely. Such security guards are also given good salaries. However, certain housing societies and commercial establishments employ watchmen at meagre salaries. These are the ones who do some other work in the day time and the duty of watchmen at night, when they fall asleep. This is not solving the purpose for which the guards or watchmen are employed. In the backdrop of the rising number of burglaries and theft, police have asked residential societies and traders to install CCTVs at societies and shops that would help police in cracking cases. Most of the security guards who are found sleeping are those deployed at ATMs, banks, financial institutions and commercial complexes as the concerned security personnel are well aware that no one comes to such places during the night. Senior officials said the initiative they have taken up for keeping the security guards on their toes will bear fruit in the coming months. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

NAB gives 160 PlexTalk units to students.description: NASHIK: The Maharashtra unit of National Association for the Blind (NAB) had made 160 PlexTalk machines available to deserving children across the state. The machine - akin to a mobile - helps the children with visual disabilities to record lectures and even refer to various books stored in it and online. These can be replayed by the machine later. The machines have been given through the ministry of social justice and empowerment. "Every year, we receive some of these machines for the students. Earlier, we used to get record players, then came the CD players. Now, the PlexTalk devices are being provided to the students," Gopi Mayur, general secretary of NAB, Maharashtra said. The units will be given to students across the state and especially for those pursuing higher studies. "It helps children to record the lectures in the class and the even refer to any book that is required for the studies. The machine can even read out the book to the student. It also has a radio facility that helps the students in studies and even recreational purposes," Mukteshwar Munnshettiwar, joint general secretary said. The students, who have used the machine in the past, have advocated its use. "I have used the machine during my studies and it has been the best help for me. I could get access to any book and lecture through the machine given to us free of cost," said Shoib Pathan, a resident of Chalisgaon. Pathan is now seeking admission for BCA (Bachelor in Computer Applications) course in Pune. His sister, Heena, also has visual disabilities. Their parents, who are farmers, have ensured both the children study. Rajendra Tarange from Baramati, who also got the machine, said there were books in Braille till Class XII but no such literature was available thereafter. Students had to completely rely on the PlexTalk. "This product will change the lives of many like us," Tarange added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gangadashhera organised at Nashik.description: On Wednesday, Gangadashhera was organised in Nashik. Akhil Bhartiya Shri Swami Samartha Gurupith and Purohit Sangh organised Gangadashhera program at Ramkund.As a part of the program, various activities were carried out. Also on the occasion, different personalities performed Gangapooja. Many Nashikites gathered on the occasion to witness the program. Appasaheb More of Samartha Kendra addressed the gathering where he stressed on taking responsibility of rivers and saving them from pollution. He also stressed on the importance of conserving water, tree plantation and other activities to keep rivers clean Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Fear grips Nashik businessmen, police to.description: NASHIK: City's business community has been gripped with fear following the incident of attempted dacoity at Untawadi branch of a private finance company Friday morning. The businessmen have asked the police to step up vigil to prevent any such incidents in future. On Friday, six armed robbers entered the office of the Muthoot Finance and shot dead an IT engineer of the company, Sanju Samuel, when he tried to stop them from thrashing the branch manager for not handing over the keys of the strong room. "The incident is an indication about the rising confidence of criminals to strike even in broad daylight. There are thousands of businessmen who deal with huge amount of cash on daily basis and after Friday's incident they have become fearful," a city-based businessman said. According to him, police need to act swiftly to instill confidence among traders and businessmen. "There have been some incidents related to shop break-ins that are yet to be resolved. We feel that policing in the city has to be more impactful that would deter the goons from carrying out such activities," he said. The president of Maharashtra Chamber of Commerce, Industry and Agriculture (MACCIA), Santosh Mandlecha, confessed that the city businessmen have become fearful after that incident. "Our request to the police is take corrective measures immediately. We have an efficient police chief and the need of the hour is to identity the criminals and take strict action against them," he said. Gorakh Chaudhary, president of the Nashik Druggist and Chemist Association, said Friday's incident has raised question over the quality of policing in the city. "I feel that the city police should put in more efforts to ensure that the city is safe. Unless they send a strong message to the criminals, such incidents would continue to take place," he said. Meanwhile, police commissioner Vishwas Nagare Patil assured the businessmen that they would go all out to ensure that Nashik is a safe city. "The incident that took place on Friday is a rare one. Our investigation so far has revealed that an organised syndicate of criminals was behind it. We have already initiated several steps to prevent such incidents," he said. According to Nagare Patil, from Saturday five beat marshals and two vehicles have been provided to each of the 13 police stations across the city. "These beat marshals have been directed to undertake patrolling round-the-clock. And senior police officers will have to monitor the movement of the beat marshals several times on a daily basis," the police chief added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Once-a-day water supply likely in three.description: NASHIK: The Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) is planning to impose once-a-day water supply in parts of the city, especially those falling under three divisions of the municipal corporation. Presently, the residents of these areas in Panchavati, Satpur and Nashik Road divisions get twice-a-day water supply. NMC officials said they were planning to resort to water cut as a precautionary measure since the monsoon has been delayed. Alarm bells have started ringing in the civic adminisatration as there is only 10% water left in the Gangapur dam complex that supplies water in Nashik city. The NMC has a total reservation of 4,900 million cubic feet (mcft) water in the complex and Mukane dam till July-end. Of which, NMC has lifted 3,905 mcft water till June 13 and the civic body still has 995 mcft water remaining from its quota. The NMC, however, will not be able to lift the entire remaining quota of water. The NMC has a reservation of 148.29 mcft water from Darna dam, which is a part of the Gangapur dam complex. However, the civic body is not lifting water from Chehadi weir of Darna dam due to contamination complaints. As a result, the NMC can now bank on 847 mcft water from Gangapur dam complex and Mukane dam. Further, 2.47 mcft water from Mukane dam is supplied to the industrial area of Cidco division of the city. Hence, the NMC has a reservation of 622 mcft on Gangapur dam. Presently, NMC is lifting 13.5 mcft of water from Gangapur dam. “We still have adequate water reservation from our quota in Gangapur and other dams. But the monsoon is yet to arrive. Hence, we will have to take some measures if the monsoon is further delayed,” said sources from NMC. Presently, the NMC is supplying water twice a day in three divisions – Nashik Road, Panchavati and Satpur, while providing once-a-day supply in Cidco, Nashik East and Nashik West divisions. One killed, three injured as heavy rains.description: NASHIK: One person was killed and three others were injured as heavy rains lashed Nashik city and parts of the district on Saturday evening. This is the first pre-monsoon rain that Nashik has witnessed. The Indiranagar police officials said that a woman was killed and two others were injured, following a wall collapse in Mahoobnagar of the Wadala area. “We have sent a team to the spot to gather details about the victims,” added police officials. In Chanwad taluka of the district a villager, Monohar Menghal, was injured as branches of a tree fell on him. He had taken shelter under that tree, following heavy rain and wind. District officials said that two bullocks died in Devdari village in the Yeola taluka after being electrocuted at 4:30pm. The rains, accompanied by strong winds, wreaked havoc and continued for 45 minutes to an hour. The fire brigade received over 150 calls from citizens, requesting them to rush to the spot as trees were uprooted and branches of trees fell on roads, blocking the movement of road users. “All our vehicles are out at various locations in the city to tackle the situation,” said the fire brigade officials. “Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) must trim the branches of the trees before monsoon sets in or else there will be more chaos when there is constant rain, accompanied by strong winds,” said traffic police officials. In several parts of the city, branches of trees fell and roofs of a few houses and shops flew off. About 10 vehicles, including three cars, were damaged as branches fell on them. In the Raigad area of Cidco, a tree fell on the roof of a house, damaging it. In the same locality, about seven two-wheelers were damaged as branches fell on them. Similarly, near the Nandur Naka area, three stationary cars were damaged as branches fell on them. Even the supply of power to various parts of the city was affected as overhead wires snapped as branches fell on them. “It will take at least one day for us to restore the power supply in the affected areas. The local staff of the power utility have started work to restore the supply,” said MSEDCL officials. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nashik: Cyber crooks cheat firm of Rs 3..description: NASHIK: Cyber theives allegedly cheated a city industrial unit of Rs 3.4 lakh US dollars between November 2018 and March 2019, the city police said. The complaint to the effect has been registered with the city cyber police team. The company officials have alleged that the cyber thieves created an email address similar to that of a Japanese firm they were dealing with. They were instructed to transfer money and thereby cheated. The case is related to Koso India Pvt Ltd located in Ambad MIDC, Nashik. The company regularly transfers money related to their business in Japan. However, in November 2018, the city-based company received a notification through company’s internal email system, asking its finance department to deposit the amounts in a new bank account created by the company. The domain of the email ids and the addresses were the same. “Since the email ids were familiar and the communication was marked to two important officials of the company, there was no chance for any of us to doubt it. Accordingly, we started sending the sum to the new accounts from time to time,” an official from the Nashik unit of the company stated in the complaint. The matter came to light in March, when for accounting purposes, the Japan-based office requested for the money transfer that was allegedly pending since November. “Following this communication, we sent the details of the transactions to the Japan office. They denied that they had received any such money transfer. The office also communicated that there was no other bank account of the company either in Japan or outside Japan,” the officer of the city-based industrial unit. The cyber police said it was a case of impersonation and cheating of the industrial unit by unidentified persons. The origin of the crime will have to be found out and it is likely to be an international team of hackers. Police feel that the suspects were tracking the regular transactions of the company and then executed the crime. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nashik: Man booked for sending obscene m.description: NASHIK: An unidentified person has been booked by police for sending obscene messages on social media to a group of women in the city. According to the complaint registered with cybercrime police station, the group received a link that upon clicking led them to another page containing obscene messages. According to an officer from cyber police station, the social media group was exclusively for women. It was around three days ago when a link was posted on the group. "It was obvious that women members clicked on the same to learn more about messages and that link took them to another page full of obscene messages," he said. "It is difficult to tell at this point in time if the phone number of any of the members was hacked or if there was any issue with wrong link or it was inadvertently sent by any of the members," he added. The exact reason for exposure of the members to the link would be found out only when the investigation is complete. The officer, meanwhile, has cautioned the social media group members to keep away from sending any such links in groups which can hurt the sentiments of anyone. "There are some who purposely do such things and pass of links in other groups. But it is advisable to stay away from such things especially when these links are likely to cause tremendous harm to the society. The members are also expected to be responsible on the issue. If in case the sender of the message is found and the intention appeared to be immoral, the sender is likely to be punished as per the sections of IT Act," the officer said. It should be noted that a similar incident had happened about a year ago when a link of obscene messages was sent from the identity of a lady doctor. "We immediately met the then commissioner of police, Ravinder Singal, who first assured us to ensure that all people in my contact were told that they should not click on the link sent by me and also delete my number. Thereafter, a police team swung into action and police caught the accused from Rajasthan," the doctor said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

NCP seeks speedy execution of water cons.description: NASHIK: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) MLA from Yeola constituency, Chhagan Bhujbal, has demanded speedy implementation of the water conservation projects in his constituency. Bhujbal, who is the former deputy state chief minister, had a meeting with the water conservation department officials of Nashik district on Thursday. “I have demanded that the department to speed up these projects, which are pending for a long time. I also spoke with the state water conservation department officials and apprised them of the issue,” added Bhujbal. Yeola taluka is one of the drought affected districts in Nashik. At present over 110 villages of the taluka are reeling under severe water crisis and over 94000 villagers have been impacted. The district administration has pressed into service over 60 tankers to provide water to the villagers. According to the senior NCP leader there are at least four water conservation projects in his constituency which despite been planned are yet to see the light of the day. “About 77 hectres of land have already been identified for a water storage facility at Deona village. I have asked the officials to speed up the project and also spoke with the senior officials of the department at Mumbai on the issue,” added Bhujbal. Morever, added the NCP legislator, the plan to establish water storage facility project at a cost of Rs 3.07 crore at Mahalkheda is yet to start. Similar projects which have been planned at Mamdapur and Savar villagers are yet to start. “I have told the department officials that they should give utmost priority to such projects that would help the locals in the long run on the water front,” he commented. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat.
